website_summaries.verdict: A classic wall safe that offers 30 min. of fire protection. It might not fit flush with the wall in all houses, so measure carefully.
pros: Install at any height between 2 wall studs
Flush keypad lets you hide safe under picture or wall hanging
Keypad features hidden lock for mechanical key override
cons: Safe may not sit flush with wall in newer homes with thinner walls
Battery connections in keypad aren't always reliable

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product was shipped quickly, it met my expectations. The safe is deep, tall. The electrical code was easy to update and easy to work. Overall an excellent product. The only "cheap" part of this safe is the interior lining. The shelves are made out of a cheap cardboard type of material that bends easily. If the shelves were more substantial, I would give this a 5 start rating.
customer_reviews.author: Andru Z

customer_reviews.title: this is not a safe for a standard 4 inch wall.
customer_reviews.text: the screw bolt holes in the side wall of the safe are too deep and they do not meet the 4 inch studs and go beyond the stud. Since this is called wall safe, in cannot be placed in a standard wall that is 4 inches. It must be installed in a wall that has an open cavity behind it or a wall that is larger than 4 inches thick. I liked that it was deeper as I needed the extra space and I do have an open space behind the wall. The only inconvenience was that I had to attach an extension to the 4 inch stud to attach the safe attachment bolts
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Many details for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not my first wall safe. I love having the extra depth and fire resistance. Make sure your studs are 2x6 or your screws won’t grab. I built a false wall space before receiving the safe and had to do a redo on the wall studs.
customer_reviews.author: Ml

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this safe in April 2014 and have been in and out of it COUNTLESS TIMES over the last 3 years without any issues! What a great reliable product and I highly recommend it to the person looking for a trouble free safe! A+ ALL THE WAY!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be nicely built. Like that it is deep inside, you must have deeper walls. Doesn't work with 2x4 walls. The counter bore for the lag bolts on the inside panels are a little bit small, making it a little bit snug for a socket to drive the bolts all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: p

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great safe and it's deeper than most in wall safes.
customer_reviews.author: TV-LESS

customer_reviews.title: Great Safe
customer_reviews.text: Great safe but the instructions could use a little work.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Salinas

customer_reviews.title: durability
customer_reviews.text: excellent safe as long you have 6 inch stud to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: SMEA

customer_reviews.title: Deep wall safe.
customer_reviews.text: Installs easily in a deep wall. Flush front easy to hide. Inner panels partially removable, had to screw through felt liner on left side; right side came out. Opens with just knob. Hidden key hole not really hidden, so hid the key! Seems tough enough, I like it, might buy another. Bad person would have to chainsaw the wall after finding it, safe.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ehman

customer_reviews.title: they could have spent another 50c to make a better battery holder
customer_reviews.text: The keypad does not work. I put fresh AA batteries in the box for the outside and found that it was a cheap piece of plastic that didn't hold the batteries properly. For an item that costs over 350$, they could have spent another 50c to make a better battery holder. Having addressed the battery box issue, the keypad still does not work. What to do?
customer_reviews.author: Vipin A.

customer_reviews.title: Great safe!
customer_reviews.text: I was remodeling my Master Suite and wanted a safe. This safe is great! It is deep and very heavy duty. I framed a 2x6 wall just for this safe and it still sticks out 2 inches. I had to wrap it with trim and it looks great. If you want it flush with the drywall you will want a 2x8 framed wall. Other than that (which is my fault) I love this safe, I just should have measure it instead of assuming it would fit a 2x6 wall.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kate Cuttables

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good product if you can find the space for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Correa

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it Safe
customer_reviews.text: Great safe but with a few caveats. A different door handle would make opening easier, can be difficult especially early on. Need a pro to install, don't try unless you know what you are doing. Otherwise a good value and sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: NS resident

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Easy to program. One drawback with the display is that you have to make sure no ones watching. One thing to note, this is designed for deep walls. In the particular place I installed it, the wall is hallow, but is built with 2x4's. The safe is designed for use with at least 2x6's, but prefers 2x8's. I had to drill new holes into the safe to be able to bolt them to the a 2x4. One last thing, measure before you cut, I assumed the wall was 14.5" between studs, it was slightly more. As you tighten the bolts, it may pull the studs in and crack the drywall.
customer_reviews.author: ArA

customer_reviews.title: Deep enough to actually store something in it
customer_reviews.text: I love this safe. Deep enough to actually store something in it. The safe is deeper than usual and will stick out of a regular wall. It took me a day to build a nice frame, including extending the dry wall and painting it.it But, it was worth the job. Love the safe!
customer_reviews.author: SAL

customer_reviews.title: just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Safe is exactly as ordered. Heavy gauge. deep pockets. glad I ordered it. I would recommend this safe if you have larger items to secure.
customer_reviews.author: mkvpta

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, operational safe, but installation improvements are needed.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, lock works great, smooth hinge operation, good finish, but installation needs improvement. Bolted it into wall with 6 screws provided with safe, but the screw holes did not line up with holes in the liner. I did not realize that liner could be removed. Now I need to patch holes in liner.
customer_reviews.author: Used_to_be_a_Sony_Fan

customer_reviews.title: Must have 2x6 studs for this product to work
customer_reviews.text: When you bolt it in it doesn’t hit the studs on a normal 2X4 stud. Must have a 2x6 for this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Wall safe
customer_reviews.text: I like the wall safe very much, easy to learn to use, and just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The keypad would not work so we have yo use the key to get in.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Great Wall Safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wall safe. It installs easily and there is plenty of room, inside to store important things. This one is designed to fit between wall studs - It bolts in with four large bolts. A burglar would have to take a section of the wall out in order to steal it. The safe is also fire-proof (to a point). It operates on batteries but also has backup keys - and a separate battery unit that can plug into the safe and open it. We have had this safe for several years and it works great. It is hidden from plain sight and we feel much more secure when we leave home, especially for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: Jayebee

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.text: This safe is not for typical walls in a typical home. It is 8" deep, which is 4 more inches than a normal wall stud. It also does not come with installation instructions of any kind! One other issue is that the velvet lined interior panels are covering up the holes for the side bolts. I poked through the fabric, not realizing that there may be space between the covered panels and the walls of the safe, but attempting to pull the panels out of the safe seemed impossible (this is where some i nstructions would come in handy).Otherwise, it appears to be made of quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but once you open it ???
customer_reviews.text: When the shipping box was opened I was pleasantly surprised. Once I read the instructions and started to look at the safe it all went Downhill. The instructions say to open safe with key to insert key and turn To the right , key needs to be turned to left to open safe The digital keypad is a very cheap plastic unit that is held in with 4 very Small self tapping screws. Safe only locks on one side and although It looks very good, I would be that I could get into this safe Without the code or key if I wanted to
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Safe was heavy, oddly shaped, and did not fit in our closet. We returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: pine valley

customer_reviews.title: excellent customer service with RYAN
customer_reviews.text: rare to find a company that is so so informed about their quality product, very impressed! wish the price was better
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ray

customer_reviews.title: Eight inches deep is hardly a "wall safe" that needs ...
customer_reviews.text: Eight inches deep is hardly a "wall safe" that needs to concern itself with recessed front panel so you can hide it with a picture on top. I dont know ANY walls that are that deep since almost all framing is done with 2X4 studs. Unless your home is very old this safe isnt going to be flush with your wall while mounted between the studs because there just isnt enough room between the two layers of sheetrock. It WILL stick out at least 3 inches.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryShowsUs

customer_reviews.title: Great Safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great safe. Bought locally and it is as described here. Unless the description was changed, the size is stated here for the exterior. That's all I needed to know, that and the cubic inches. Installed easily and is a solid unit.
customer_reviews.author: S. C.

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions
customer_reviews.text: I don't own this product, so take the star rating with a grain of salt (thought fair since other reviewer used 1 star). But here are the dimensions I found(designed to fit between studs): Interior Dimensions 12"W x 19-1/4"H x 5-5/8"D Exterior Dimensions 13-5/8"W x 20-3/4"H x 8"D Weight 47 Lbs. Cubic Inch Capacity 0.75 Flange Size 15-1/8"W x 22"H Anchor Holes 3 per side (6) Interior Shelves 2 Removable
customer_reviews.author: H. Webber

product_meta.title: BUYaSafe WES2113-DF Fire Resistant Electronic Wall Safe 8" Deep for Deeper Walls
product_meta.description: This wall safe is an excellent choice for home or office use. Quick and convenient access, easy programing and can be installed at any height on interior wall. It's very easy to install between 2 wall studs. It comes with a Fire-Liner velvet interior for a great plush look and feel. The Fire-Liner will give a 30 minute fire protection for paper stores inside the safe. The 2 shelves are removable for convenience. The keypad is flush with the safe's flange, therefore able you to hang a picture over the safe to conceal it from view. The keypad has a hidden lock to open the safe with a mechanical override key (2 included) . This key is used only when batteries are dead or keypad is damaged. Since this safe is 8" deep we recommend hiring a contractor or a handyman for the installation. Made for deep walls 8" or more. The door of this wall safe is made of 3/16" thick solid steel plate to prevent from forcibly prying open the door.
feature_bullets: 8" Deep burglary resistant wall safe with digital electronic locking system.
Excellent burglary protection with a heavy duty 3/16" solid steel door and flange
Designed to be installed between 16" o/c wall studs. For 8" thick walls or thicker
Approximately .75 cubic feet of storage space.
Dual live bolts, Made of heavy duty gauge steel.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars60 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
